Common Library¶

This file will contain documentation for common library modules.

Remote Procedure Call (RPC) Library¶

The RPC Library leverages JSON-RPC 2.0 and the socket library to allow function calls using TCP/IP Packets. This library is used heavily in InstrumentControl and InstrumentManager.

JSON-RPC¶

class labtronyx.common.rpc.jsonrpc.JsonRpcPacket(str_req=None)[source]¶

RpcServer¶

class labtronyx.common.rpc.server.RpcServer(**kwargs)[source]¶

Flexible RPC server that runs in a Python thread. Wraps any Python object and allows remote machines to call functions and receive returned data.

Parameters:
  • logger (Logging.logger) – Logger instance if you wish to override the internal instance
  • port (int) – Port to attach srv_socket to
  • name (str) – Internal name for the RPC server thread

Note

Method calls to functions that begin with an underscore are considered protected and will not be invoked

findMethod(method)[source]¶

Return a bound method after searching through the server methods and the methods of all registered objects

getActiveConnection()[source]¶

Get the connection that currenly holds the RPC execution lock. Can be used by registered objects to get the address of the connection

Returns:socket.socket
rpc_getConnections()[source]¶

Get the number of connections to the RPC server

Returns:int
rpc_getHostname()[source]¶

Get the hostname of the RpcServer host.

Returns:str - hostname
rpc_getMethods()[source]¶

Get a list of valid methods in the registered objects. Protected methods that begin with an underscore (‘_’) are not included.

Returns:list of strings
rpc_getPort()[source]¶

Get the bound port of a running RpcServer thread.

Returns:int - Port
rpc_isRunning()[source]¶

Check if there is an RpcServer thread running

Returns:bool - True if running, False if not running
rpc_stop()[source]¶

Close the server srv_socket and stop the RpcServer thread

Note

This operation may take a small amount of time for the srv_socket to register the stop request.

rpc_uptime()[source]¶

Get the uptime of the RpcServer

Returns:int - uptime in seconds

RpcClient¶

class labtronyx.common.rpc.client.RpcClient(address, port, **kwargs)[source]¶

Flexible RPC client that connects to an RpcServer instance either on a local host or remote host. Abstracts a remote object using the magic of Python. By utilizing functions from the remote RpcServer and object that extends RpcBase, RpcClient can dynamically create method aliases. In this way, a RpcClient object can “become” an instance of an object on a remote host.

Establishes a TCP connection to the server through which all requests are send and responses are received. This is a blocking operation, so only one request can be sent at a time (currently).

To manually call a remote method, use the function RpcClient._rpcCall

TODO: Add batch processing

Parameters:
  • address (str - IPv4) – IP Address of remote RpcServer (Defaults to ‘localhost’)
  • port (int) – Port of remote RpcServer
_addAlias(methodName)[source]¶

Dynamically create a method internal to the RpcClient object that will invoke an RPC method call when called.

Parameters:methodName (str) – Name of method
_enableNotifications()[source]¶

Open a UDP port and send a notification registration request to the server.

Returns:True if successful, False otherwise
_refresh()[source]¶

Get a list of methods from the RPC server and dynamically fill the object

_rpcCall(remote_method, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calls a function on the remote host with both positional and keyword arguments

Returns:
  • Whatever the remote function returns
Exceptions:
  • AttributeError when method not found (same as if a local call)
  • RuntimeError when the remote host sent back a server error
  • Rpc_Timeout when the request times out
_setTimeout(new_to=None)[source]¶

Set the Timeout limit for an RPC Method call

Parameters:new_to (float) – New Timeout time in seconds
